0: A man suspected of holding a 15-year-old girl captive in his apartment for two years tried to kill himself with a box cutter after she escaped, investigators said March 28. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Kabu Terauchi, a 23-year-old resident of Tokyo’s Nakano Ward, is being treated at a hospital in Izunokuni, Shizuoka Prefecture, west of Tokyo, for injuries on the right side of his neck that are serious but not life-threatening. Police plan to arrest Terauchi, who had been placed on the wanted list, after he recovers. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Terauchi is believed to have abducted the junior high school student from Asaka, Saitama Prefecture, just north of Tokyo, in March 2014, and kept her under restraint until she escaped and was taken into protective custody on March 27. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to the prefectural police of Shizuoka and Saitama, a newspaper delivery man reported a blood-covered man walking on a street in Ito, Shizuoka Prefecture, around 3:15 a.m. on March 28. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Officers from the Ito Police Station found the man and confirmed his identity with his driver’s license. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Terauchi, who graduated from Chiba University this month, was carrying a box cutter and a wallet. He said he used the blade in a suicide attempt, but police could not interrogate him because he was bleeding heavily, they said. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR According to the Saitama prefectural police investigation headquarters for the case, the girl escaped from Terauchi’s apartment room in Nakano Ward on March 27 after he left the home to “go shopping in Akihabara.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She called police from a public telephone at JR Higashi-Nakano Station around 12:30 p.m., and police officers from the Nakano Police Station immediately took her into protective custody. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR She told police that she was under “full-time, de facto confinement” by her abductor. She also said she was “abducted in front of my home in Saitama by being forced into a car by an unfamiliar man.” NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR Saitama police obtained an arrest warrant for Terauchi, and investigators searched his home early on March 28. NEWLINE_CHAR NEWLINE_CHAR The girl disappeared after leaving her junior high school shortly after 3 p.m. on March 10, 2014. A first-grader at the time, she was last seen chatting with a young man in front of her home in Asaka.
